comment.author: 70316038@N04
comment._content: If you look at all the steam trains either side with full loads of coal, I think this was taken during one of the bridge load tests. Imagine seeing a sight like that today.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/wepidgeon] Yes indeed it was. I had added the incorrect title to this one! The correct title is now there. - AG

comment.author: 28304000@N00
comment._content: Most locomotives were bound for the scrap heap and were not in service - they were not operating under their own power and they were not in steam.  They were towed by a few in steam at the front.  If you look carefully you can see that not all the locmotives even have a tender attached to them.
